Tables

We provide a variety of options to style your tables.

  • Default basic styling for every table includes table border and header border. Use class .cl-table-basic
  • Fully styled table is available with borders, zebra stripes and hover. Use class .cl-table
  • Zebra striping can be achieved by applying classes on alternate, even or odd rows. You may stripe even, odd, or both rows. Class can be overrriden to change the color of the stripe. Use classes .cl-a-even and .cl-a-odd
  • Hover option classes for striped rows are applied similar to zebra striping. Colors can be changed. Classes are .cl-a-even-hover and .cl-a-odd-hover
  • Highlighter classes are available to highlight a particular row .cl-hightlight-green , .cl-highlight-yellow and .cl-highlight-alert
                    <table class="cl-table-basic">
                        <caption> Basic table</caption>
                        <thead>
                        <tr>
                            <th>Name</th>
                            <th>Category</th>
                            <th>Plan</th>
                        </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tbody>
                        <tr class="cl-highlight-green">
                            <td>Anthony Zeid</td>
                            <td>3</td>
                            <td>Weekly</td>
                        </tr>
                        <tr class="cl-a-even cl-a-even-hover">
                            <td>Roman</td>
                            <td>2</td>
                            <td>Daily</td>
                        </tr>
                        <tr class="cl-highlight-yellow">
                            <td>Rina Joy</td>
                            <td>1</td>
                            <td>monthly</td>
                        </tr>      
                        <tr class="cl-highlight-alert">
                            <td>Tina Turner</td>
                            <td>1</td>
                            <td>Annual</td>
                        </tr>                              
                    </table>
Basic table
Name Category Plan
Anthony Zeid 3 Weekly
Roman 2 Daily
Rina Joy 1 monthly
Tina Turner 1 Annual
Zebra Striped even rows
Name Category Plan
Anthony Zeid 3 Weekly
Roman 2 Daily
Rina Joy 1 monthly
Tina Turner 1 Annual
Highlighted rows
Name Category Plan
Anthony Zeid 3 Weekly
Roman 2 Daily
Rina Joy 1 monthly
Tina Turner 1 Annual

Responsive Tables

We provide three breakpoints for responsive tables.

  • A small table of 3X3 is responsive till the small breakpoint at 640px. Use class .cl-res-table-sm
  • A medium size table of 5x3 is responsive till the medium breakpoint at 768px. Use class .cl-res-table-md
  • A larger table, larger than medium, is responsive till the last breakpoint at 960px. Use class .cl-res-table-lg
  • Pre-styled table. To use the styling applied to the folowing tables use class .cl-table

In order to have the column heading display on the responsive table they need to be set on the td.< br /> For example for the small table you will have to specify the following in the media query. There are three column headings so we go upto nth-of-type(3). 

@media screen and(max-width: 640px){
.cl-res-table-sm td:nth-of-type(1):before {
    content: "Heading Col1";
    }
    .cl-res-table-sm td:nth-of-type(2):before {
    content: "Heading Col2";
    }
    .cl-res-table-sm td:nth-of-type(3):before {
    content: "Heading Col3";
    }           
}
}
Responsive Small Table
Heading Col 1 Heading Col 2 Heading Col 3
Data Col 1a Data Col 2a Data Col 3a
Data Col 1b Data Col 2b Data Col 3b
Data Col 1c Data Col 2c Data Col 3c

Heading Col 1 Heading Col 2 Heading Col 3 Heading Col 4
Data Col 1a Data Col 2a Data Col 3a Data Col 4a
Data Col 1b Data Col 2b Data Col 3b Data Col 4b
Data Col 1c Data Col 2c Data Col 3c Data Col 4c
Data Col 1f Data Col 2f Data Col 3f This cell contains longer data

Heading Col 1 Heading Col 2 Heading Col 3 Heading Col 4 Heading Col 5 Heading Col 6 Heading Col 7 Heading Col 8

Headings

The framework provides responsive headings for h1 thru h6. They have been scaled using media queries.
The same styles are also provided as classes h1 through h6, to be used anywhere on the website.

Using element tag h1 through h6 

<h1> Heading1 </h1> 

<h1> Heading2 </h1> 

<h1> Heading3 </h1> 

<h1> Heading4 </h1> 

<h1> Heading5 </h1> 

<h1> Heading6 </h1>

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 3

Heading 4

Heading 5
Heading 6

Heading style on p element using classes h1 through h6 

<p class="h1">Heading 1</p> 

<p class="h2">Heading 2</p> 

<p class="h3">Heading 3</p> 

<p class="h4">Heading 4</p> 

<p class="h5">Heading 5</p> 

<p class="h6">Heading 6</p>

Heading 2

Heading 3

Heading 5

Heading 6

Example of .cl-code

To apply background color to an element use

background-color: red;

Example of .cl-var

Define some text as variables in a document:

The area of a triangle is: 1/2 x b x h, where b is the base, and h is the vertical height.

Aligned rigth using class cl-align-right

Aligned center using class cl-align-center

Example of vertical alignment

Aligned top using class cl-align-top

Aligned bottom using class cl-align-bottom

Aligned center using class cl-align-middle

Example of blockquote using class cl-blockquote

Here is a quote from WWF's website:

"http://www.worldwildlife.org/who/index.html"

For 50 years, WWF has been protecting the future of nature. The world's leading conservation organization, WWF works in 100 countries and is supported by 1.2 million members in the United States and close to 5 million globally.
